Author: juwo
Content: Many people to whom I have demo'ed, have said that I have a good idea. I also have an almost beta, prototype.\nI have approached 16 potential cofounders since May 2006, but they didnt want to take risks with their career, had families to support, had their own career track to pursue and frankly, wondered how it would make money.

Author: danielha
Content:
I just read that article too. WordPress.com will be acting as an identity provider, similar to AOL.

Any thoughts on OpenID implementation for existing popular networks? Considering that relying sites can filter which providers they allow authentication from, I am overall positive about an increased usage of OpenID.

Author: python_kiss
Content: Thank you for posting this. ReadWrite web is reporting that 37Signals has also joined the bandwagon:\nhttp://www.readwriteweb.com/archives/wordpress_37signals_openid.php

Author: juwo
Content: yes. if you have $1M to invest in the USA, you can get an automatic - and almost immediately - green card.\n(my green card took 4 years and $5K to get).

Author: python_kiss
Title: Dot-Com CIOs Are Back in Demand :)

Author: danielha
Content:
Not a huge surprise, I suppose. Google's ad network is still the market leader. Though, I am very interested to see how much more relevant Yahoo's Search Marketing has gotten with its implementation of Pandora.

So far, AdSense is the most flexible when compared to Yahoo's Publisher Network but there are many more players in this game now.

Author: danielha
Content:
And a lot of other potential big name developments never saw the light of day due to the "corporate" part of corporate R&D. Yes, it is true that corporate R&D produced a long lists of greats; however, some of these faced serious barriers to realization because of the hedging of risks that big companies do.

It's not to say they don't develop great things. What they do, they do well because they pour their resources into it. It's the daring, wild, revolutionary ideas that have become uncommon. The smaller company or group of hackers have become the suppliers of those.

Author: rms
Content: I'd rather have a Tesla Roadster.

Title: Another Yahoo Loss: Friendster makes Google its ad and search supplier
